{{Infobox military person |honorific_prefix = |name = Abdul Jabbar al-Oqaidi |honorific_suffix = |native_name = |native_name_lang = |image = |image_size = |alt = |caption = |birth_date = |death_date = |birth_place = |death_place = |placeofburial = |placeofburial_label = |placeofburial_coordinates = |nickname = |birth_name = |allegiance = {{plainlist | * {{flag|Syria}} (until 2011) * {{flagicon|Syria|1932}} [[Syrian National Coalition]] (2012–present) }} |branch = {{plainlist | * [[Syrian Arab Army]] (until 2011) * [[Free Syrian Army]] (2012–present) }} |serviceyears = 1989–present |rank = [[Colonel]] |servicenumber = |unit = [[Mechanized Infantry]]
[[Tawhid Brigades|Liwa al-Tawhid]] |commands = Aleppo Revolutionary Military Council |battles = {{plainlist | * [[Battle of Aleppo (2012–present)]] * [[Battle of al-Qusayr (2013)]] *[[Aleppo offensive (October–December 2013)|Operation Northern Storm]] }} |battles_label = |awards = |spouse = |relations = |laterwork = |signature = |website = }} '''Abdul Jabbar al-Oqaidi''' (also spelled '''al-Aqidi''') is a commander of and spokesman for the [[Free Syrian Army]] in [[Aleppo]]. A former [[colonel]] in the [[Syrian Arab Army]], he defected in early 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-18560_162-57531939/inside-syrias-civil-war/ |title=Inside Syria's civil war |publisher=CBS News |date= |accessdate=24 January 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://english.al-akhbar.com/node/10421 |title=Aleppo clashes continue as opposition demands UN meet |publisher=Al Akhbar |date=29 July 2012 |accessdate=24 January 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://www.naharnet.com/stories/en/49356 |title=162 Dead in Syria as Army Claims Control of Aleppo Rebel Bastion |publisher=Naharnet |date=8 August 2012 |accessdate=24 January 2013}}{{cite news|author=Michael Burleigh |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/debate/article-2182572/Rebel-atrocities-Syria-rebels-true-colours-given-Assad-boost-propaganda-war.html |title=Rebel atrocities in Syria show the rebels' true colours, and given Assad a boost in the propaganda war |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=2 August 2012 |accessdate=24 January 2013}}{{cite news|author=|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/syrian-rebel-commander-says-aleppo-to-be-liberated-within-days-1.455013 |title=Syrian rebel commander says Aleppo to be liberated 'within days' |publisher=Haaretz |date=31 July 2012 |accessdate=24 January 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://www.chinapost.com.tw/international/middle-east/2012/07/23/348523/Battle-to.htm |title=Battle to 'liberate' Aleppo has begun: defecting rebels |publisher=The China Post |date=23 July 2012 |accessdate=24 January 2013}} On 3 November 2013, he announced his resignation from the Aleppo Revolutionary Military Council due to disunity among the rebels and constant retreats from battles, including the [[Aleppo offensive (October–December 2013)]].{{cite news|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2013/Nov-03/236696-top-syrian-rebel-commander-announces-resignation.ashx#axzz2ivQ9OK68|title=Syrian top rebel commander announces resignation|author=Leith Fadel|work=The Daily Star|date=3 November 2013|accessdate=27 November 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/syria/10425001/Syria-rebel-quits-after-battlefield-defeat.html|title=Syria rebel quits after battlefield defeat|author=Ruth Sherlock|work=The Telegraph|date=4 November 2013|accessdate=31 July 2016}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Oqaidi, Abdul Jabbar al-}} [[Category:Syrian colonels]] [[Category:Defectors to the Free Syrian Army]]
